abstract.para: The topic covers the automatic runs of the &tr-up; command.

topic.para: Automatic updates are controlled by systemd.timer that runs once per day. This applies all updates and informs rebootmgrd that the machine should be rebooted. You may adjust the time when the update runs, see systemd.timer(5) documentation.

section.title: Configuring notifications of failed updates
section.para: When an automatic &tr-up; fails, the failed snapshot is deleted and the system may reboot. You then cannot find out that the last automatic update failed.
